title: First images of cerebrospinal fluid in the brain during sleep (2019)
description: A new study from Boston University is the first to illustrate that the brainâ€™s cerebrospinal fluid pulses during sleep, and that these motions are closely tied with brain wave activity and blood flow. It may confirm the hypothesis that CSF flow and slow-wave activity both help flush toxic, memory-impairing proteins from the brain.
